messages.message: Second issue, this one from Blend. They are getting an error where they don’t have permission to execute files in the scripts directory, despite (apparently) having the ability to write those scripts. Any suggestions on where to start with this?
I think that user needs to be set as an admin of the repo in order to run custom scripts / UDF. You can confirm with the infra team (maybe @Heymian?) to see how the ACL should be set up for the user.

yeah execute requires additional permissions, and it’s basically disallowed for user-owned repos unless the user is a site admin. If you move the repo into an org, org admins can grant execute permissions to repos in the org
I just learned about this yesterday :’D
Ah! Ok, that makes sense (I think).
haha if you/will want a quick course in all things acl on our platform, lemme know. happy to show you guys how it works.

Quick sanity check before I reply to the user:
```
Hello Amit,

The way permissions work in Instabase, a user is not allowed to run user-defined functions (scripts) unless the repo is part of an org with execute permissions granted to refiner or the user is an site-administrator. Please move your repo to an org that has the execute permission set, or have your administrator give you site-admin privileges.

Thank you,

David
```

the “with that access” sounds a bit funny to me. Should we be more specific: “part of an org with execute permissions granted to refiner in the repo”. And how about “or the user is a site-administrator”?
I edited the message to reflect your suggestions.
